section.name: JGGApi - Gadu-Gadu protocol implementation.
section.p: JGGApi is a Gadu-Gadu protocol implementation based on specification from EKG. Gadu-Gadu is a very famous Instant Messanger in Poland.

Thanks to the libary it is very easy to create applications that communicate with Gadu-Gadu server. It uses commonly used design patterns (GoF) that minimizie the learnining curve for developers. It has a good internal design and realizes a paradigm of programming - programming by extension. What is more, it will help developers that are going to write applications similar to Kadu, Gaim or command-line EKG to fasten their development process.
if you want to start using library and learn how to use it, it is suggested that you take a look at our Getting Started guide.

section.name: Releases
section.p: There is an old version of the library that has already been released. It is jggapi-0.94 and you can download it here: jggapi-0.94. It works fine but it has limited functionality and does not have a support for searching in public directory, loading and storing information there and also it does not support contact list at all.

The new version of library jggapi-1.0-dev has many improvements and clearer design. It is not compatible with the old version, interfaces have changed significantly but porting from an old version should not be a difficult task. It also has the support for features that are not available in previous version. Note that this version has suffix dev because it has not been tested extensively. It would be very appreciated if users could provide feedback about the usage of this library.
It is strongly recommended that you use the newest version instead of an old one because support for 0.94 will no longer be provided.

section.name: Features
section.p:
The version (1.0-dev) allows:
Sending and receiving messages.
Gives possibility to retrieve confirmation of message delivery.
Exporting and importing of the user's contact list.
Setting status and notification of statuses that are changed by monitored users.
Ability to read and write personal information to the public directory.
Possibility to search public directory based on user defined criteria.

ul.li: The current version is not thread safe but the thread safety check will be perfomed soon.

Initial status that is set in LoginContext does not work. At beginning we send Login60 packet but the Gadu-Gadu server is ignoring it. Therefore we have to sent status packet after connecting. What is more, it is known that this is also done by a standard Gadu-Gadu client, i.e. explicite setting status.
Write support for larger contact lists. Current implementation is limited to contact lists that are not more than 2048 bytes long.
Add ability to send larger notify lists, i.e. list that is send at the beginning to notify Gadu-Gadu server what users we want to monitor.
The libary is not tested enough therefore adding JUnit tests is of high importance.
